channel.title: My Media Player Program - VB.net
channel.description:
My Programming Teacher told the class that if we made a program that played music, we could listen to music. She also said if we made a program that plays game we can play games...So I made this program. Its uses the WMP Control to play the music (to keep it simple) and it uses the Flash Control to play .swf files. I used a itunes skin from www.deviantart as my interface but did the hover buttons myself. Im not finished with the flash player, but I've done just enough so you guys can criticize me harshly. Its written in VB.net, but you'll need VB Express 2008 to open the project file. I have attached a .7z file; in it is the program, compiled, and the source code. Tell me what you think.
http://www.2shared.com/file/11084852/195f9118/Media_Player.html (The site wouldn't let me attach so heres the link ^) :confused:

For those who cba downloading:

I chose a perfect song to test it out with
[/quote]Am I the only one noticing the volume buttons being reversed from their appropriate icons?[/quote]

Hahahah shit I guess I need to fix that huh? Thanks for noticing that.

Ok dick face mod who warned me on 2/17/2010 go suck a cock. I quoted wrong. Unnecessary spamming my ass. Really your life must suck dick if all you do is warn people for random shit.

item.title: My Media Player Program - VB.net
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Freddy1990:

That actually doesn’t look all that bad, nice job

Thanks, I’m making another one now. Based on this skin. I got the person that made it to give me the PSD so that makes it alot easier.
Im not going to base this one off of the WMP control. Im going to figure something else out, like using directx. But I have to learn about all of that now.

xde5bl.jpg580×548

EDIT: Wow this is going to be easier than I thought. I had tried making the program using the skin about before but had a problem. I had to create a path to shape the controls and I was using X and Y values. Well I just figured out that the X and Y grid is relative to the location of the control rather than the form. So when I was doing playControlPath.AddLine(200,200,200,400) It would be playControlPath.AddLine(0,0,0,200). Then Me.picPlayButton.Region = New Region(playControlPath).

Read full topic
